channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for OR
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for OR

item.title: Report X-2023110409
item.description:
Report X-2023110409

Identified by scraper @ 2023-12-06T18:14:46+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-11-04
  • City: PORTLAND
  • State: OR
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: UNLOADER FOUND LEAKING PACKAGE. RESPONDER CALLED FOR CLEANUP. RESPONDER OPENED BOX FINDING LEVELGUARD PART A B, WITH PART A BEING THE LEAKER (NON-HAZARDOUS). RESPONDER DETERMINED PART B IS AN UNDECLARED HAZMAT. SUPERVISOR VERIFIED POTENTIAL HAZMAT STATUS.

item.title: Report X-2023110407
item.description:
Report X-2023110407

Identified by scraper @ 2023-12-06T18:14:46+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-11-02
  • City: HILLSBORO
  • State: OR
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: PACKAGE WAS FOUND BY SMALLS TENDER AND REMOVED FROM THE BELT/SINGULATOR AND PLACED IT ON THE GRATING. PACKAGE WAS CONTAINED IN A SPILL TRAY AND BROUGHT TO THE PSC. UPON FURTHER INSPECTION AND AN SDS SEARCH, IT WAS FOUND TO HAVE BEEN IMPROPERLY SHIPPED. SIX SIDED PHOTOS TAKEN. HMSC CALLED. SIX SIDED PHOTOS SEND TO ADG COMPLIANCE. DAMAGE ENTERED INTO ETT.

item.title: Report X-2023110368
item.description:
Report X-2023110368

Identified by scraper @ 2023-12-06T18:14:46+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-11-04
  • City: PORTLAND
  • State: OR
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: THE UNLOADER DISCOVERED THE PACKAGE ON THE FLOOR OF THE TRAILER. THE UNLOADER DID NOT INITIALLY NOTICE THE DAMAGE DUE TO THE DARKNESS INSIDE OF THE TRAILER. EMPLOYEE MOVED THE PACKAGE TO THE UNLOAD ROLLERS, WHERE HE THEN SAW THAT THE PACKAGE WAS PUNCTURED AND LEAKING SMALL AMOUNTS OF LIQUID. FOLLOWING PROCEDURES, HE SET IT DOWN AND NOTIFIED MANAGEMENT WHO CALLED FOR A RESPONDER. THERE WAS NO RESIDUE ON THE GROUND OR ON ANY OTHER SURFACE FOR THE RESPONDER TO ABSORB, SO THE PACKAGE WAS CONTAINERIZED AND MOVED TO THE PSC FOR PROCESSING.

item.title: Report E-2023110615
item.description:
Report E-2023110615

Identified by scraper @ 2023-12-04T15:11:38+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-11-29
  • City: CLACKAMAS
  • State: OR
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: XPO Logistics terminal UPO experienced a release from a box containing (4) 1-gallon poly jugs. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup operations. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 1 ounce of material released to the packaging/container only. The cap of one 1-gallon poly jug was crushed causing a release. The damaged jug was removed from the box and containerized along with PPE into a 15-gallon poly jug. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

Package had been loaded on its side and crushed by weight of package above. 5 gallon pail dented and liqwuid was pushed out DescribePack: dented. liquid pushed out. no holes or cracks DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: placed in salvage drum

item.title: Report X-2023111053
item.description:
Report X-2023111053

  • Incident Date: 2023-11-10
  • City: PORTLAND
  • State: OR
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: PACKAGE AS LEAKED ON BY AN UNKNOWN SUBSTANCE WHILE IN SHIPPING CONTAINER. WHILE REPACKING THE ITEMS IN THE BOX IS WAS DISCOVERED THAT THERE WAS AN UNDECLARED AEROSOLS ALONG WITH A FIRE EXTINGUISHER INCLUDED IN THE ITEMS. PROCESSING AS UNDECLARED.

item.title: Report E-2023110319
item.description:
Report E-2023110319

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-30T18:13:44+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-11-14
  • City: EUGENE
  • State: OR
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS FREIGHT, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: A plastic box on a pallet containing (14-15) 50lb plastic jerricans fell over in the offloading process resulting in (2) plastic jerricans cracking and releasing 1-gallon of UN2783 into a 1'x1' puddle on the dock. The jerricans cracked against the plastic pallet that was under the plastic box. A contractor clean-up the release and re-palletized the intact product. No storm drains, waterways or soil were impacted by the release.

item.title: Report X-2023110385
item.description:
Report X-2023110385

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-30T18:13:44+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-11-13
  • City: SPRINGFIELD
  • State: OR
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: RESPONDED TO A PACKAGE THAT WAS COLD TO THE TOUCH. UPON INSPECTION OF THE CONTENTS DISCOVERED APPROXIMATELY 8 POUNDS OF DRY ICE COOLING POSSIBLE AGRICULTURE SAMPLES. THERE ARE NO DANGEROUS GOODS MARKS OR LABELS ON THE OUTER BOX. THIS PACKAGE WAS SHIPPED FROM OREGON USING UPS ACCOUNT NUMBER 1Y197A, PRTUSA, 31783 S MERIDIAN RD., HUBBARD OR 97032.

item.title: Report X-2023110421
item.description:
Report X-2023110421

Identified by scraper @ 2023-12-06T18:14:46+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-10-19
  • City: SOUTH BEACH
  • State: OR
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On 10/19/2023 at approximately 1230, Dangerous Goods Administration received a call from Employee 679706 at the station location in South Beach, reporting an undeclared aerosol shipment. The shipment consisted of 3 boxes of floral arrangements, one of which had an aerosol can of paint inside that was clearly seen through the hand holes. The offending shipment was not prepared in accordance with IATA regulations, missing the required marking, labeling, packaging and paperwork. The other two packages contained non-dg commodity. The package is being held for an FAA investigation.

item.title: Report X-2023110374
item.description:
Report X-2023110374

Identified by scraper @ 2023-12-05T18:13:43+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-10-31
  • City: CORVALLIS
  • State: OR
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On Oct 31st during the PM sort, 2 packages came through that were cold to the touch and were marked on the outside of the package as perishable. After contacting DG Admin the packages were opened and UN1845 Dry Ice, 9 waas found inside the package. It was not marked on the outside that dry ice was contained inside the package. The shipper was contacted to come and retrieve the package.

item.title: Report X-2023110217
item.description:
Report X-2023110217

Identified by scraper @ 2023-12-05T18:13:43+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-10-31
  • City: PORTLAND
  • State: OR
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: RESPONDED TO A PACKAGE THAT NEEDED TO BE REWRAPPED DUE TO BEING LEAKED ON BY ANOTHER PACKAGE IN THE SORT. UPON INSPECTION OF THE CONTENTS DISCOVERED TWO INNER BOXES MARKED AND LABELED AS UN1070 NITROUS OXIDE WITH CLASS 2.2 AND 5.1 DIAMOND LABELS. EACH INNER BOX CONTAINED SIX NITROUS OXIDE BOTTLES. THERE ARE NO DANGEROUS GOODS MARKS OR LABELS ON THE OUTER BOX.
